meanings.definition: To free from something undesirable or unwanted.
meanings.sent1: She was ridding her room of old toys.
meanings.sent2: The maid was ridding the house of dust.
meanings.sent3: He joked about ridding the fridge of expired food.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like ridding the room of shadows.
meanings.sent5: The fresh air was ridding the room of stuffiness.

meanings.sent1: Drinking water was ridding her of thirst.
meanings.sent2: The medicine was ridding him of pain.
meanings.sent3: The funny movie was ridding her of boredom.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was like ridding the room of tension.
meanings.sent5: The warm tea was ridding her of chills.

meanings.definition: To dispose of or get rid of.
meanings.sent1: She was ridding her closet of old clothes.
meanings.sent2: The company was ridding itself of excess inventory.
meanings.sent3: He was ridding the garden of pesky weeds.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like ridding the path of obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The broom was ridding the floor of crumbs.
